definition[0]: laws to protect companies that are in financial difficulty, limiting payments they have to make to CREDITORs (=organizations they owe money to)
example[0]: If the company doesnâ€™t file for bankruptcy protection (=ask the authorities to give it protection from creditors) it faces a major problem on June 15, when $42.2 million of payments on senior debt are due.
example[1]: The building company emerged from bankruptcy protection under a reorganization plan.
